data.title: ISA COURSES — International Surfing Association
data.text:
Recognized by the International Paralympic Committee (IPC) as the International Federation for Para Surfing, also known as Adaptive Surfing, the ISA has taken an active role in the worldwide development, promotion and structure of the sport. This program is part of the ISA’s ongoing effort to create a global platform for universal access to the sport and enable Para Surfers to achieve sporting excellence and inspire others. While the competitive element of Para Surfing is a rapidly growing aspect of the sport, the Adaptive Surf Instructor Program focuses on broader inclusion and grassroots development.

In partnership with AmpSurf, Surfability UK, and members of the global Adaptive Surfing community and supported by the Foundation for Global Sports Development, the ISA has developed this International Adaptive Surf Instructor Certification Program. This program is complementary to the ISA Coaching and Instructing Program and accessible for surf instructors, surf schools, and Adaptive Surfing organizations worldwide.

The ISA Adaptive Surf Instructor Certification Course ensures those who are engaged in Adaptive Surf Instruction and Therapy are adequately trained and have the necessary knowledge and skillset to improve the skills of the Adaptive Surfers that they are instructing. This enables surf schools to employ certified adaptive surf instructors and offer surf lessons to surfers with physical, mental, cognitive, and behavioral health disabilities. This also provides organizations that run Adaptive Surfing programs and therapy the opportunity to train their staff and volunteers. Overall, this course contributes to a safer environment for Adaptive Surfing instruction and therapy worldwide.

Military Veterans are eligible for course scholarships via AmpSurf.

To validate an ISA coaching and instructing certification, participants must complete a water safety certification course. The water safety certificate must be maintained by a bi-annual recertification.

Where available, ISA coaches and instructors are encouraged to participate in the ISA/ILS Water Safety Course (see course schedule).

FIND A COURSE >>

Otherwise, an ISA Instructor or Coach may complete a Lifeguarding/Lifesaving Course endorsed by an ILS Member (see equivalencies) or a course which includes as a minimum the following:

• Action and communication in emergency situations

• Basic first aid and life support/CPR

• Unconscious board specific rescue and aftercare

• Minimum fitness requirement of a timed pool (25m) swim of 200m in less than 5 mins or an equivalent water based fitness test

• Maximum validity of two years, with minimum recertification of a 4 hour refamiliarization and then assessment of the theory and practical skills again. Must include fitness, Life Support/CPR and an unconscious board specific rescue and aftercare
